overview:
Konstantin Popov entered the games industry in 2002 when he founded his first game company that was successfully sold in 2006 in Russia. In 2007 he established Biart. Development of commercially successful high-technology games and educational software including serious games became the main goal of the company.

For these purposes Biart under management of Konstantin started the development of its own multiplatform engine called biEngine. He is the author of most of the Biart Company’s projects (Depth Hunter, Depth Hunter 2, Deep Black, Deep Black: Reloaded, Reef Aquarium, Diver: Deep Water Adventures, Check Dive, etc.).

From 2008 Konstantin Popov works in GR direction and during last years has formed close relationships with different Russian state authorities and ministries. From the year 2009 Konstantin Popov is a co-founder of political non-profit partnership “National Innovative System”.

Besides managing the Biart, Konstantin organized and managed the All-Russian Conference on Game Industry (ACGI 2009 and 2010) http://www.acgirussia.com.

There it was taken a decision to establish Russian Association of Developers and Publishers of Game Industry and Interactive Technologies (RADIT). Association is aimed to develop game industry in Russia, collaborate with international market.

From the year 2010 Konstantin Popov is a co-founder and President of RADIT. http://www.radit.ru.

Konstantin has left RADIT in 2011.

Biart Company LLC was incorporated in Delaware in August 2011 with all agreements re-concluded for the new legal entity. The Russian company was closed and there’s only a R&D office of Biart in Russia at the moment.

All assets and operational activities of the company are in the USA. Biart’s official office is in Texas, USA. Biart has plans to set up a representative office in California, USA, in 2013.
